SickChill.description:
Automatic Video Library Manager for TV Shows.

Based on custom docker image: https://hub.docker.com/r/linuxserver/sickchill, available for amd64 and arm64 architecture.
SickChill.more_info:
Automatic Video Library Manager for TV Shows. It watches for new episodes of your favorite shows, and when they are posted it does its magic.

Help and documentation

Help and documentation on how to configure SickChill can be found on the project's Github page. In particular:

  • Wiki pages
  • Frequently Asked Questions

8081.description: Port for SickChill Web interface. Suggested default: 8081.
8081.label: WebUI port

/config.description: Choose a share to host the configuration settings for SickChill. It is important that the owner/group specified later have full access to the share (R/W/E).
/config.label: Config

/download.description: Choose a share to download to (also known as the sickchill monitor folder). It is important that the owner/group specified later have full access to the share (R/W/E).
/download.label: Download

/tv.description: Choose a share to host shows (also known as parent folder). You can add additional shares later via the rock-on's settings menu. It is important that the owner/group specified later have full access to the share (R/W/E).
/tv.label: TV

PGID.description: Enter a valid GID to use along with the above UID. It(or the above UID) must have full permissions to all Shares mapped in the previous step.
PGID.label: GID

PUID.description: Enter a valid UID to run SickChill under. It must have full permissions to all Shares mapped in the previous step.
PUID.label: UID
